class.name: Polygon2D
class.description: A Polygon2D is defined by a set of points. Each point is connected to the next, with the final point being connected to the first, resulting in a closed polygon. Polygon2Ds can be filled with color (solid or gradient) or filled with a given texture. [b]Note:[/b] By default, Godot can only draw up to 4,096 polygon points at a time. To increase this limit, open the Project Settings and increase [member ProjectSettings.rendering/limits/buffers/canvas_polygon_buffer_size_kb] and [member ProjectSettings.rendering/limits/buffers/canvas_polygon_index_buffer_size_kb].

method.name: add_bone
method.description: Adds a bone with the specified [code]path[/code] and [code]weights[/code].

method.name: erase_bone
method.description: Removes the specified bone from this [Polygon2D].

method.name: get_bone_count
method.description: Returns the number of bones in this [Polygon2D].

method.name: get_bone_path
method.description: Returns the path to the node associated with the specified bone.

method.name: get_bone_weights
method.description: Returns the height values of the specified bone.

method.name: set_bone_path
method.description: Sets the path to the node associated with the specified bone.

method.name: set_bone_weights
method.description: Sets the weight values for the specified bone.

members.member: If [code]true[/code], polygon edges will be anti-aliased.
The polygon's fill color. If [code]texture[/code] is defined, it will be multiplied by this color. It will also be the default color for vertices not set in [code]vertex_colors[/code].
Added padding applied to the bounding box when using [code]invert[/code]. Setting this value too small may result in a "Bad Polygon" error.
If [code]true[/code], polygon will be inverted, containing the area outside the defined points and extending to the [code]invert_border[/code].
The offset applied to each vertex.
The polygon's list of vertices. The final point will be connected to the first. [b]Note:[/b] This returns a copy of the [PoolVector2Array] rather than a reference.
The polygon's fill texture. Use [code]uv[/code] to set texture coordinates.
Amount to offset the polygon's [code]texture[/code]. If [code](0, 0)[/code] the texture's origin (its top-left corner) will be placed at the polygon's [code]position[/code].
Amount to multiply the [code]uv[/code] coordinates when using a [code]texture[/code]. Larger values make the texture smaller, and vice versa.
Texture coordinates for each vertex of the polygon. There should be one [code]uv[/code] per polygon vertex. If there are fewer, undefined vertices will use [code](0, 0)[/code].

Color for each vertex. Colors are interpolated between vertices, resulting in smooth gradients. There should be one per polygon vertex. If there are fewer, undefined vertices will use [code]color[/code].
